Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Gray Ranger "scmom"
Reviews.Content: I had been informed about this brand and style of camera from a salesman at a store that didn't carry these.  So I checked Amazon, and sure enough, they had them...and in RED, too.  I take a lot of photos for school, and I wanted a small, easily portable camera for sports related functions.  A lot of photos and videos taken in gyms...and if you've experienced that, you know the lighting in gyms is poor, at best.  These are not professional quality, nor do I expext them to be, but the photos and videos come out WONDERFUL!  And the megapixel can be adjusted to smaller than 12 so I can take photos that are easily emailed to relatives.  OH - and you can zoom WHILE videoing!  I am VERY happy with this camera - for an aim and shoot digital I would recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Outdoors, Disappointing Indoors
Reviews.Author: L. Oyster
Reviews.Content: This camera does indeed take magnificent pictures if you are outdoors or somewhere very brightly lit. Magnificent! But indoors or someplace with medium light, not even low light, MEDIUM LIGHT, it does a general focus rather than picking an object or face and focusing on that. It's weird to explain, but rather than a small green box indicating where the camera is focusing, one big box appears and takes up most of the screen, and there is no way to change it. The general focus means that it doesn't actually focus on anything so nothing looks sharp. At all your family gatherings such as birthdays and holidays, the pictures will be disappointing, even mid-day with all the shades open, the pictures are severely lacking. The zoom was a nice bonus but not needed so I swapped it for Canon SD 940 IS and couldn't be happier. Outdoor pictures are just as good but indoor pictures are far superior.

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Mr.Marvin
Reviews.Content: I think I found the perfect camera.  I had a Panasonic Lumix TZS with a 10 power leica lense and 3 mega pixal.  It was easy to use and took good pictures and the lense was fantastic.  However I was limited to the size of the pictures that could be produced.  Before that I had an Olympus OM1 Single lens reflex which took the best pictures ever.  I still have it but it is not digital.  I wanted a digital camera that could take better quality pictures and be able to enlarge them more then snap shot size. I loved the leica lens on the TZS.The Panasonic Lumix ZR1 seemed to fit my criteria exactly.  I liked the 10 power lens that my TZS had but I needed to use a tri pod for pictures using anything more then about 4 power.  I saw the lumix ZR1 with the 8 power leica lens and with 12 mega pixel and the price was right.  Since I already had a Panasonic Lumix TZS, the ZR1 was easy to learn to use.  Everything was the same almost.  The ZR1 has a little more manual control available which is nice.  I can set a minimum shutter speed and set the film speed and the camera will do the rest.I have not had a chance to take a lot of pictures with it but the ones I have taken are very very good.  I have not had a chance to test this camera in low light so I can not comment on that aspect.  It also takes movies but I am not interested in that.  The lense is phenomenal.  It is clear and crisp at all stages.  It starts out at a 25mm wide angle and goes to an 8 power telescope.  The camera itself is a lot smaller then my TZ3.  A lot thinner and only slightly thicker then my cell phone.  So it is easy to take with me. It fits easily in my pocket.The camera was made in Japan and not China and is of the best quality construction.  It is fast.  It comes on instantly and is ready to take pictures in seconds.  It is also very fast taking consecutive pictures compared to my old camera.  I can just keep snapping the shutter with only a slight delay.  I was going to get a black camera but at the last second decided on the red and I am glad I got the red, it is beautiful.  I have more cameras then I need but I think this camera, the ZR1, is the one I will use the most.

Reviews.Title: Useless AC Adaptor
Reviews.Author: Leo P. Isotalo
Reviews.Content: Generally, a terrific, reasonably easy to use camera, and far superior to my 7 yr old Olympus that it replaced. The DMC-ZR1 has a host of features I haven't begun to use----but plan to, of course (:-). There was no warning (buried in fine print in the "Basic Operating Instructions") that the supplied software would not function with 64bit Vista, but that's a minor annoyance.Here's what really annoys me: I'm accustomed to uploading from my camera to PC using an AC/DC convertor, to avoid that rare instance of battery failure while uploading. So, I bought the DMW-AC5PP Adaptor, only to discover that there is no direct connection to the camera, and that another accessory is required,i.e., the DC Coupler DMW-DCC5, which does not come along with the AC Adaptor. That is in itself strange: Why sell an incomplete product?Wait, it gets worse! The DC Coupler is not on Amazon, nor is it on hand at the Panasonic Parts Depot in WA State. "Call back in a few weeks", the rep said.I'll be more careful in the pre-purchase stage the next time!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Old Blue "Lucky"
Reviews.Content: I just gave my wife the new Lumix DMC-ZR1 and she loves it.  Stabalization works great even though she typically punches the button. Great quality for reasonable price.  We'll know more after we use it for  while.  Packed with user friendly features.

Reviews.Title: best upgrade camera
Reviews.Author: Angela D. Troy "sgibeachgirl"
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of features that really make this camera easy to use.  I upgraded from a Cannon SD110 and I like the zoom capabilities when I take videos and the extra wide angle and zoom when taking still pictures.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-AR1 camera
Reviews.Author: D. Fisk
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an Olympus camera I've had for many years.  The LUMIX has performed very well for the short time I've had it (1 month).  The only problem is that it doesn't have an optical viewfinder.  The 8x optical zoom is a great feature.  I like the size and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: just what i was looking for
Reviews.Author: Paul F. Brown
Reviews.Content: great camara, very small fits right in my pocket.  batteries last about 2.5 hrs. this camara was $50 cheaper thru amazon than Walmart.  great productPaul Brown

Reviews.Title: Nice compact camera
Reviews.Author: Dina Labarge "ashton"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera.  It takes great indoor and outdoor photos. Its small enough for your pocket and zooms in pretty far.  Its takes a faster picture than my old compact camera. No complaints

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, good pictures
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Shutter delay is about the best available for a digital "point and shoot" camera. Quite happy with it overall.

Reviews.Title: The pictures we have taken so far are wonderful
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Kapash
Reviews.Content: Very nice compact design with a bright easy to use LCD display.  Excellent resolution and good construction.

Reviews.Title: Could be better !
Reviews.Author: mogu
Reviews.Content: Light or lack of it makes a difference in the picture quality. But it is a good camera.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY PANASONIC!
Reviews.Author: suzannell
Reviews.Content: I ordered a camera from them and it quickly had a system error and would not function. They sent a refurbished one, same error, and a another refurb, same error. Basically just sent junk refurbished items until it was out of warranty. Happened again when it was out of warranty by a couple of weeks and then said too bad despite the fact we'd only had the replacement for about two months. Horrible product, even worse customer service!

Reviews.Title: excellent pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Granddad
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1 takes outstanding pictures so much so that it rivals much more expensive full size cameras. Because the photo quality is so good this has become my go to camera for almost all occasions. I highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Crap
Reviews.Author: R. Pritchett
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for 16 months and have not used it that much really. I just noticed that it is no longer working. I turned it on and  the subject is not displayed on the LCD screen and all pictures are just black. Don't recommend...

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Deal "Big Kid"
Reviews.Content: We love this camera. It takes great video clips too. We have an SLR too but this one takes most of our pictures because it is easy to carry and takes Great pictures. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Andrea D "browneyedgirl"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!  I bought it to use in place of my Canon Rebel for quick shots of my newborn daughter.  The quality of the pictures is good for a point-and-shoot as long as you spend a little time getting to know the settings and use them correctly.  I especially like the setting that calcuales your child's age when you take a photo.My only complaint with this camera is the battery.  It requires a special charger...which I have misplaced leaving my camera unusable until I either find the charger or find a place to buy a new battery.

Reviews.Title: Lumix Camera for Travel
Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: I bought the Lumix DMC-ZR1 to take on a trip to Italy after years of using Sony Cybershot cameras. I bought it because a friend of mine had such great pictures from it. Then I researched the reviews of small cameras and watched the video for it on CNET. The reviews were great for what I was looking for. I really enjoyed it and have great photos from the trip. Clear and great color. It is very portable, the batteries have a long life and the zoom is wonderful. I found the positioning of the zoom somewhat problematic and required some getting used to. Also when I carry it in my pocket without a case, sometimes the selection dial moves and changes the setting. Then when you pull it out and start shooting, it is on the wrong setting. But overall I am very pleased with the camera and like it better than the Sonys that I have had.

Reviews.Title: Sleek, small and super!!!
Reviews.Author: SamanthaPk
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera yesterday. I was told this is better that its successor the ZR3 model for its picture quality. I love the design and the ease of use. No complicated buttons or features. This camera is the best for taking simple pictures for fun but not for professional photography. The zoom is excellent and settings are automatically adjusted for amateurs. All in all, this is one of the easiest and coolest camera I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1
Reviews.Author: atgio
Reviews.Content: I have had the Panasonic Lumix ZR1 for a little over a week.  I purchased this camera based on the reviews that I read.  I agonized over the different brands and models just like you probably are right now.  I chose Panasonic and I am extremely glad that I did.  The pictures I just took this past weekend of my son's baseball tournament turned out amazing.  A crystal clear picture with a fantastic zoom. My wife and I are going on vacation next week and I can't wait to take some pictures with the camera.  Everything positive that I read about this camera is true.  Thanks to all of those reviews, I now know I purchased the right product.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Barber
Reviews.Content: My old digital camera is now some seven years old and has only two megapixels of resolution. Clearly, it was time to upgrade. After a lot of online research, I went with the Panasonic because of a high rating at the [...] site (always a "must consult" before making high-tech purchases). The camera is stunning in appearance, almost jewel-like. I ordered the metallic red model and it is just beautiful. It reminds me of an expensive wristwatch, say a Rolex. The camera is almost exactly the size of a deck of playing cards and is quite heavy for its size. It feels solid, as though it were made to industrial specs. It is anything but plastic or toylike. The small moving parts feel precision made and strong. Nothing flimsy about this camera.When first charging the battery with the plug-in wall charger, it took several hours to reach full charge. Not knowing how much memory is required for high resolution photos, I bought an 8 Gig SDHC memory card. I figured this would probably suffice for say, 100 shots. I later Googled the subject and discovered that high-res JPEG photos in the 12 Megapixel range translate into about 1500 photos with this card!! Well, this was clearly a case of overkill and I would go with a 4 Gig card were I to order it today.I took my camera outside on a bright and sunny day, and determined to see how sharp it's 12 Megapixel images can be, placed the camera on a tripod for really steady shots. I found that it is very hard to see the LCD screen in bright sunlight. I had to hold my hand over the screen to aim the camera. It wasn't possible to make out fine detail but I could see well enough to aim the camera composition-wise. The wide angle works great indoors and I was very pleased with the zoom function. It's impressive. I also made a few indoor shots and found that the flash worked unexpectedly well. In general, well lit rooms photograph with sharp and clear colors but darker spaces take on a more contrasty appearance. My photos were generally sharp and detailed. Colors were good. It is obvious that 8 by 10 enlargements with no loss of detail, are a breeze for this camera. Who needs 11 by 14's for family snapshots? One downside though. This camera has a problem with high contrast subjects. My first digital camera does too, so maybe it's characteristic of digital designs. For example, when shooting dark green trees against a brightly sunlit street, the camera lowered exposure to capture the street at the cost of making the trees unnaturally dark and losing shadow detail. There is a built in menu-selected exposure compensation (EV +/-), and perhaps this will solve the issue. I suspect it will but have not played with this function yet.A final point. The software is lousy. It's bloated at about 400 Megs and has the usual "photo editing" functions for correcting red-eye and re-organizing photos. Slooowww to install, the software uses Microsoft's NET.framework platform. This caused my computer (I run Windows XP home SP3), to download four updates over the next day or so. The software also ran automatically and without my permission, ALL of my photos. These number over two thousand and would have gone on for hours. I could not find anyway to disable this feature and had to open the My Music folder to stop it. The software would not run with the camera until it finished "reviewing" all of my photos. Fed up, I removed the software completely. One bright note, it does un-install quickly and cleanly.A hot tip: Go to the [...] site and download the FastStone Image Viewer. This is a wonderful photo editor and completely free. I swear by it.There is no mention of this on the box, but the software will run on Win 7 as well as Apple's OS X Snow Leopard. An included leaflet says that it will not run with Mac OS.When I connected the camera to my computer directly, with no Panasonic software...good riddance, my computer immediately recognized ths camera as an "F: drive" and downloaded photos through Windows. This worked perfectly. I conclude that it will likely work fine with Apple too. Just treat the camera as a thumb-drive. In conclusion, this is a beautiful camera which I got at the earlier price of about $202 with free shipping, and is likely the last snapshot camera I will ever need. With a bit of exposure compensation (EV adjustments), for contrasty subjects, I'm certain the camera will be perfect for your general snapshot needs. I recommend this one, but about that sudden price increase...

Reviews.Title: if only that battery...
Reviews.Author: mark reinhoudt "feedback is the best way to m...
Reviews.Content: I am using my Panasonic for about three months now and am very happy with it. Only there is one thing that annoys the hell out of me and that is that you have to remove the battery to charge it: Panasonic is really lacking in that department as pretty much all other manufacturers have moved to USB charging.Picture wise the camera is a real great contender and also the video does its job (maybe a bit brighter than the pictures) but hey it is a photo camera with a video option.I download the pictures direct from the card on to my Apple MBP and thus bypassing doing it with a cable from the camera. This saves quite some battery life as otherwise I probably would have 'retired' the camera in favor for one with the early stated USB charging.Buying this camera gives you a nice tool with interesting set of features that will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M. Platt "camera guy"
Reviews.Content: This camera works so well it makes taking photos easy and is so small it can be taken anywhere.  No problems.

Reviews.Title: This seller is a liar and a thief.
Reviews.Author: alo2279
Reviews.Content: Called the seller to return the defective camera within the correct time frame and was given the run-around (at least 30 phone calls) for 2 months before they decided to refund my money less a 10% re-stocking fee. When they received the item they took 25% because of "missing" battery and charger which were in the box. The seller lies and stole my money. I finally got Amazon to refund the remaining amount because the seller stopped taking my phone calls and emails to a fake email address I was given came back un-deliverable. I considered filing a police report but just wanted to be done with the nightmare. DO NOT BUY FROM DISCOUNTS JUNGLE!!! THEY WILL STEAL YOUR MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: Just want to point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: HillTop
Reviews.Content: Either I got a faulty camera or I need photography lessons...  I wanted a camera I could pick up, point and shoot.  I purchased this before a Disney World vacation, and all of the pictures were blurry and had an orange tint.  If I didn't change the settings every time I used it, the pictures were ruined.  I had a casio before this, which was terrific!  Returning this and getting something different!
